text.p: Australian bond yield spreads to both the U.S. and Canada were slightly wider going into the weekend after the local market attracted profit-taking after a firm performance this week.

Traders said the Australian/U.S. 10-year bond yield spread had narrowed to around 106 basis points during after hours trading on Thursday, its lowest level in over two years, but failed to sustain the break below 110 basis points.

The market is showing some caution ahead of the Federal Open Market Committee meeting on Tuesday, although current domestic fundamentals should see bonds ride out any backlash from U.S. Treasuries if the Fed does tighten.
The local market also underperformed Thursday's thinly traded session in Canadian bonds, and lagged New Zealand debt on the day, although bonds there also finished below the day's highs in price.
